Mistry as Director of the Company.

MORE:
In terms of Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, we would like to inform you that Mr. Ishaat Hussain has ceased to be a Director of the Company with effect from September 3, 2017, as per the retirement age policy for Directors of the Company.

It may be noted that the shareholders of the Company had, at its twenty-first Annual General Meeting held on June 17, 2016, approved the appointment of Mr. Ishaat Hussain as Director of the Company up to September 2, 2017.

The Board and management place on record their appreciation for the contribution made by Mr. Ishaat Hussain during his tenure with the Company.

We request you to kindly take on record the above.

MORE: Sub:	Financial Results for the year ended March 31, 2017     The audited standalone and consolidated financial results for the year ended March 31, 2017 of the Company under Ind AS ('Statement'), which were approved and taken on record at a meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company held on Tuesday, April 18, 2017, were submitted to the stock exchanges thereafter.     We enclose herewith the revised Statement for following changes in the format -    a)	The 'Other income' is now shown below 'Income from operations (net)', which was earlier shown below 'Profit from operations before other income, finance costs and tax'. Consequently, the row 'Profit from operations before other income, finance costs and tax' has been deleted.  b)	A row for showing 'Total income' has been added after 'Income from operations (net)' and 'Other income'.   c)	Under 'Tax Expense', the 'Current tax' and 'Deferred tax' have been bifurcated and shown as individual lines as against single line for 'Tax expense' earlier.    The figures as reported earlier remain unchanged.    The above information is also available on the website of the Company: www.tcs.com.

NEWSSUB: Updates on Statutory Auditors
MORE:
Tata Consultancy Services Ltd has informed BSE that pursuant to Section 139 of the Companies Act, 2013 and Rules made thereunder, it is mandatory for the Company to rotate the current statutory auditors on completion of a maximum term permitted under the said Section.

Accordingly, based on the proposal of the Audit Committee of the Company, the Board has, at its meeting held on February 20, 2017, recommended the appointment of B S R & Co. LLP, Chartered Accountants as the statutory auditors of the Company. B S R & Co. LLP will hold the office for a period of 5 (five) consecutive years from the conclusion of the 22nd Annual General Meeting of the Company scheduled to be held in the year 2017 till the conclusion of the 27th Annual General Meeting to be held in the year 2022, subject to the approval of shareholders of the Company.

Further, based on the proposal of the Audit Committee of the Company, the Board has appointed KPMG India, Chartered Accountants, to audit the financial statements under the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for a period of five financial years (FY) from FY2017-18 to FY2021-22.

This is for your information and records

NEWSSUB: Allotment Of Bonus Equity Shares
MORE:
Further to our letter no. TCS/Bonus/SE/46/2018-19 dated May 26, 2018 intimating the Postal Ballot results for Issue of Bonus Equity Shares, we hereby inform you that the Company has, on June 3, 2018, allotted 1,91,42,87,591 Equity Shares of Re.1 each as fully-paid up Bonus Equity Shares, in the ratio of 1 Equity Share of Re.1 each for every 1 Equity Share of Re.1 each held, to eligible members whose names appeared in the register of members/list of beneficiary owners as on June 2, 2018, being the record date fixed for this purpose.
Consequently, the paid-up equity share capital of the Company stands increased to Rs.3,82,85,75,182 consisting of 3,82,85,75,182 Equity Shares of Re.1 each from Rs.1,91,42,87,591 consisting of 1,91,42,87,591 Equity Shares of Re.1 each.

NEWSSUB: Tata Consultancy Services Ltd reply to clarification sought by the exchange
MORE:
The Exchange had sought clarification from Tata Consultancy Services Ltd with respect to news appearing www.deccanherald.com - January 27, 2018 "Tata Elxsi begins internal process for merger".

Tata Consultancy Services Ltd has submitted the clarification as follows:

"In this regard, we would like to state that TCS is a global company and the among the largest in terms of market capitalization. There is lot of interest in the Company from the media and analyst community, which also tracks and reports on the possible M&A deals in the IT industry.

We do not have any specific comment to offer with regard to the above news item."

NEWSSUB:
Disclosure Under Regulation 30 Of SEBI (Listing Obligations And Disclosure Requirements)
Regulations, 2015
MORE:
Mr. V. Ramakrishnan, Chief Financial Officer would be retiring from the services of the Company,
effective April 30, 2021.
The Board of Directors has, at its meeting held today, based on the recommendations of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee, appointed Mr. Samir Seksaria as Chief Financial Officer Designate, and he would take over from Mr. Ramakrishnan V. as the Chief Financial Officer, effective May 1, 2021.
Mr. Samir Seksaria, Vice-President Finance, has been with TCS since 1999 and has held various positions in business consulting and finance. He currently heads the Financial Analytics, Planning and Business finance function. He is a commerce graduate from Narsee Monjee College, Mumbai and a
member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India.

NEWSSUB: Update On EPIC Matter
MORE:
Pursuant to Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, we hereby inform you that in the EPIC Systems Corporation matter, the US Court of Appeals, 7th Circuit, Chicago, returned a verdict on the appeal filed by TCS, reducing the damages award.

The Court held that the punitive damages award of $280 million is constitutionally excessive and directed the Trial Court to reassess the punitive damages. The Court upheld the compensatory damages award of $140 million. TCS is exploring the options available to it, as it believes that there is no evidence of misuse of EPIC information by TCS. TCS will vigorously defend its position before the relevant court.
HEADLINE:
Pursuant to Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, we hereby inform you that in the EPIC Systems Corporation matter, the US Court of Appeals, 7th Circuit, Chicago, returned a verdict on the appeal filed by TCS, reducing the damages award.

The Court held that the punitive damages award of $280 million is constitutionally excessive and directed the Trial Court to reassess the punitive damages. ....

MORE:
This is with reference to our letter reference number TCS/BM/6/SE/2020-21 dated April 16, 2020, for submission of Financial Results for the year ended March 31, 2020 and
Recommendation of a Final Dividend. We would like to inform you that the Unique Document Identification Number (UDIN) in the audit report on consolidated annual financial results for the year ended March 31, 2020 issued by B S R & Co. LLP, the Statutory Auditors of the Company was inadvertently mentioned 20049625AAAAAJ4293 instead of
20049265AAAAAJ4293, due to a typographical error.

A letter dated May 22, 2020 received from B S R & Co. LLP in this regard is attached herewith for your reference.

Other than aforementioned, there are no other changes.

NEWSSUB: Disclosure Under Regulation 30 Of SEBI (Listing Obligations And Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015
MORE:
Pursuant to Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, the Company had on January 4, 2020, informed the stock exchange regarding the appeal filed by the Company in the Hon'ble Supreme Court of India on January 3, 2020 (i) to set aside the Judgement dated December 18, 2019 in the case of 'Cyrus Investments Pvt. Ltd. & Anr. v. Tata Sons Ltd. & Ors.' (Company Appeal No. 254 of 2018) and 'Cyrus Pallonji Mistry v. Tata Sons Ltd. & Ors.' (Company Appeal No. 268 of 2018) which has directed reinstatement of Mr. Cyrus Pallonji Mistry as Director of the Company for rest of the tenure and (ii) in the interim stay on operation of the said Judgement to the extent it relates to the Company.

The Hon'ble Supreme Court of India has, vide its order dated January 10, 2020, granted a stay on the operation of the said Judgement and had posted the matter for detailed hearing at a later date.

NEWSSUB: Appointment of Company Secretary and Compliance Officer
MORE:
The Board of Directors has, at its meeting held today, based on the recommendations of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee, appointed Mr. Pradeep M. Gaitonde as Company Secretary & Compliance Officer with effect from November 1, 2021, to take over from Mr. Rajendra Moholkar.

Mr. Pradeep M. Gaitonde is a Chartered Accountant and Company Secretary. He has degrees in Commerce and General Law. He is presently the Finance Head for TCS Europe and UK. He joined TCS in 2006 and has over thirty years experience in finance, governance and secretarial functions.

NEWSSUB: Disclosures Under Regulation 30(1) Of SEBI (Listing Obligations And Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 - Reappointment Of Mr. Rajesh Gopinathan As CEO&MD And Mr. N. Ganapathy Subramaniam As COO&ED
MORE:
This is to inform you that the Board of Directors has, at its meeting held today, based on the recommendations of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee and subject to approval of the shareholders, approved the re-appointment of:

1. Mr. Rajesh Gopinathan as Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director for a term of five years from February 21, 2022 to February 20, 2027.

2. Mr. N Ganapathy Subramaniam as Chief Operating Officer and Executive Director from February 21, 2022 to May 19, 2024, as per the retirement age policy of the Company.
Mr. Subramaniam is the brother of Mr. N. Chandrasekaran.

Mr. Rajesh Gopinathan and Mr. N Ganapathy Subramaniam are not debarred from holding the office of Director by virtue of any order of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) or any other such authority.

NEWSSUB: Announcement under Regulation 30 (LODR)-Press Release / Media Release
MORE:
This is to inform you that Tata Consultancy Services Ltd has signed a material multi-year contract with a large American company expanding its long-standing partnership to accelerate their cloud transformation journey and transform their technology landscape into a modern hybrid cloud stack for greater agility, flexibility, and improved operational resilience.

The cloud enabled operating model will be powered with advanced cognitive automation capabilities which will improve availability of business applications and enhance user experience.  This transformation will serve as a platform for their future growth enabling business expansion, incubate new business models, improving customer experience and other strategic benefits. 

 The above information is also available on the website of the Company: www.tcs.com
